Package sawfowl.localeapi.utils

Class LegacyLocaleUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sawfowl.localeapi.utils.AbstractLocaleUtil
      • sawfowl.localeapi.utils.LegacyLocaleUtil
  • public class LegacyLocaleUtil
extends AbstractLocaleUtil
    Most likely, this is the final version of the class..
    Okay, what is this? This is an assistant class that will help you understand your language packs.
    Those. Instead of using yaml/hocon files that are dependent on the read encoding of the file, you can safely write your locales in the .properties file without worrying about encoding the file at all.
    http://java-properties-editor.com/ - program for editing ;)

    Class rewritten for use in plugins written on Sponge API, here, the methods from the above api are used. But it is not worth it to rewrite / delete a couple of points for other applications.

      • checkComponent

        public boolean checkComponent​(boolean json,
                              net.kyori.adventure.text.Component component,
                              java.lang.String comment,
                              java.lang.Object... path)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocaleUtil
        Checking for the existence of a path in the localization file. And the serialization of the Component class to JSON string.
        The path is created if it does not exist.
        Specified by:
        checkComponent in class AbstractLocaleUtil
        Parameters:
        json - - If true, the Component will be serialized to a JSON string.
        component - - Component class
        comment - - Comment to path. Not necessary. You can specify null. Not used with JSON configuration.
        path - - Path in the config file.
        Returns:
        false if the path already exists.
        true if path is created.

      • checkListComponents

        public boolean checkListComponents​(boolean json,
                                   java.util.List<net.kyori.adventure.text.Component> components,
                                   java.lang.String comment,
                                   java.lang.Object... path)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLocaleUtil
        Checking for the existence of a path in the localization file. And the serialization of the Component classes list to JSON strings.
        The path is created if it does not exist.
        Specified by:
        checkListComponents in class AbstractLocaleUtil
        Parameters:
        json - - If true, then the list of Component classes will be serialized to JSON strings.
        components - - List of Component classes.
        comment - - Comment to path. Not necessary. You can specify null. Not used with JSON configuration.
        path - - Path in the config file.
        Returns:
        false if the path already exists.
        true if path is created.
